name: Data Science Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of the fundamentals of data science.

options: The study of how to create data
The study of how to analyze and interpret data
The study of how to store data
The study of how to delete data

questions.questionText: What is the difference between a population and a sample?
options: A population is a subset of a sample
A sample is a subset of a population
A population includes all possible values, while a sample includes only some of them
A sample includes all possible values, while a population includes only some of them

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of exploratory data analysis?
options: To find patterns in the data
To create a model for the data
To make predictions about future data
To measure the accuracy of the data

name: Data Science Tools Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of the tools used in data science.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a popular programming language used in data science?
options: HTML
CSS
JavaScript
Python

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of SQL in data science?
options: To perform statistical analysis on data
To create data visualizations
To manipulate and query data in databases
To generate reports about data

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of machine learning in data science?
options: To find patterns in the data
To create a model for the data
To make predictions about future data
To measure the accuracy of the data

name: Data Science Statistics Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of statistics used in data science.

questions.questionText: What is the difference between a mean and a median?
options: A mean is the middle value, while a median is the average
A median is the middle value, while a mean is the average
A mean and a median are the same thing
A mean and a median are both measures of variability
The sum of the squared deviations from the mean
The average of the squared deviations from the mean
The square root of the variance
The difference between the largest and smallest values

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of hypothesis testing?
options: To find patterns in the data
To create a model for the data
To make predictions about future data
To test a claim about the population based on a sample of data

name: Data Science Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of the fundamentals of data science.

options: The process of extracting useful information from data
The process of storing data for future use
The process of deleting data
The process of creating data

questions.questionText: What is the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning?
options: Supervised learning uses labeled data, while unsupervised learning uses unlabeled data
Supervised learning uses unlabeled data, while unsupervised learning uses labeled data
Supervised learning and unsupervised learning are the same thing
Supervised learning and unsupervised learning both use labeled data

questions.questionText: What is overfitting in machine learning?
options: When a model is too simple and underperforms on new data
When a model is too complex and performs well on the training data but poorly on new data
When a model is not flexible enough to capture the underlying patterns in the data
When a model is too flexible and captures noise in the data

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of data normalization?
options: To remove outliers from the data
To make the data easier to visualize
To convert the data to a standard scale
To add noise to the data

questions.questionText: What is the difference between a p-value and a confidence interval?
options: A p-value measures the strength of evidence against the null hypothesis, while a confidence interval measures the range of plausible values for the population parameter
A confidence interval measures the strength of evidence against the null hypothesis, while a p-value measures the range of plausible values for the population parameter
A p-value and a confidence interval are the same thing
A p-value and a confidence interval both measure the probability of a type I error
